reviews.review_msg: Amazing course!! Rajiv Kozhikode completely changed how I think about organizations. His original research is super engaging, and he gives you real freedom with memo assignments to explore what you find interesting. Trial assignments were super helpful too — great feedback and guidance. Super smart prof, super chill vibe. TAKE THIS CLASS!!

Rajiv's lectures are both engaging and highly informative. He makes class participation feel natural and is approachable, always patient, and thorough when clarifying doubts. Be prepared, though—this course involves a lot of reading and writing. That said, it's absolutely worth the effort. You will learn a lot.

If you are a person that learn concepts better with real-life examples, he is the right prof. Lectures always contains real life examples to explain the concept in real practice, and you can tell he is passionate. Would definitely take his class again if I can. Graded by 2 of 30% MT, 10% presentation, 20% project, and 10% participation

Rajiv is a good lecturer who knows the material quite well and seems to care about students learning objectives. However his course is graded quite competetively being it is an upper divsion course, and his lectures and partcipation is very vital for success. His instructions are very ambigous so be aware when preparing for midterms or projects!!!

Are you concentrating in HR? if not, stop reading now and look into 381.  RK is a great guy who really knows his stuff.  Course is challenging, especially for those who don't read English well (readings are academic meaning complex English use). Participation matters so you cannot be shy. Interesting course no doubt, but only take 374 if its needed

One of a kind course... Makes you rethink about things that you often take for granted about organizations. Exams are not easy even though they are open book (although technically there is no text book, only assigned readings). Despite this, I enjoyed the course. Definitely recommend.

At times, it was difficult to understand due to his accent + not using a mic in an echoing lecture hall. All exams are open book, and he highly encourages students' own interpretation of theories on  presentation which was great. Recommend this course to all accounting students the format is quite similar to BUS421.
